sub_title: University Lecturer Geo-Energy, Natural Hydrogen, Energy Transition Advisor
summary:
Geo-science professional with 30 years of experience in subsurface projects, technology development, geodata management and training. President of the German Geological Society (DGGV).

Specials:
- Geo-Energy consulting
- Subsurface Evaluation & Advisory
- Specialist Geoscience Services
- Sedimentology - Carbonate & Clastic Reservoirs
- Research & Technology Management
- Decision Based Integrated Reservoir Modelling (DB IRM)

Other:
- Geodata management - Open Subsurface Data Universe (OSDU)
- Product management - agile software development
- SPE Distinguished Lecturer 2016/17
- Training - graduate development programs
- Lecturer for Geo-Energy Master Program at Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg, Germany

projects: [{'title': 'Open Subsurface Data Universe', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Started out game changing geodata management project in 2011 called SUMO which developed into the cloud based Subsurface Data Universe (SDU) solution and later into the open source software development managed by the Open Group now called Open Subsurface Data Universe (OSDU). The OSDU Forum has now more that 200 members and is offered via all major cloud service providers globally.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jürgen', 'last_name': 'Grötsch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'University Lecturer Geo-Energy, Natural Hydrogen, Energy Transition Advisor'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Johan', 'last_name': 'Krebbers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'IT CTO (VP IT Innovation) & GM Digital Center of Excellence (Emerging technologies)'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Phillip', 'last_name': 'Jong', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Retired from Shell on August 1, 2021 '}]}, {'title': 'Digital Geology', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': '\u200bDigital Geology is a novel subsurface training platform in Shell, where all sources of subsurface and field data in the Upstream business are used and integrated into a single virtual collaborative environment, complemented with real geological exhibits and augmented reality techniques. It is designed to strengthen skills of Shell’s Petroleum Engineers in subsurface evaluation, reservoir characterisation and model construction at all relevant geological scales. Therefore, Digital Geology serves E&P professionals as a subsurface “flight-simulator” and helps them to make the right investment-decisions.\n', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jürgen', 'last_name': 'Grötsch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'University Lecturer Geo-Energy, Natural Hydrogen, Energy Transition Advisor'}]}]
